II. Purpose of Addendum
The Licensee has requested an additional program to their facility called the Girls
Gap Program. The age range is from 15 to 17 years old with a capacity of fifteen.
III. Methodology
12/11/02 – Request for a license modification to include an additional program for
the facility.
12/11/02 – Application received from the facility requesting a license modification.
Also received a license clearance for the Executive Director.
02/19/03 – Environmental Health Inspection received with an “A” rating.
07/24/03 – Fire Safety Inspection received with an “A” rating.
10/20/03 – Program statement and program design received.
10/31/03 – Staff training hours and schedule received.
11/13/03 – On-sight inspection of the Girls Adventure Program (GAP).
11/17/03 – Fee received from Lansing.
11/24/03 – 2003 Annual Inspection for Challenge Course received.
IV. Description of Findings and Conclusions
The facility is currently approved for 117 residents in an open residential treatment
setting with no behavior management room. The licensee is requesting to add an
additional program called Girls Adventure Program (GAP) with a capacity of fifteen
residents to their already existing 117residents. The total capacity will be 132
residents.
The Program Director submitted a copy of the Program Statement for the Girls
Adventure Program (GAP). The program is provided to young women who make
risky decisions regarding substance abuse, behavior management, education, family
and legal issues an opportunity to mature through the use of personally challenging
activities. The activities are designed to enhance self-esteem, self-discipline and
develop skills that will provide them the tools to make positive life changing choices.
They will accomplish adventures and overcome challenges.
The Program will be located on the main campus of Crossroads for Youth in Oxford
Michigan. This is a three hundred and twenty (320) acre wooded campus. The
residents will be sleeping in a dormitory, attending groups in an adjoining room and
preparing and eating their meals in the out of doors as much as possible. Residents
will attend a half a day of classes at the on grounds school. When they are not in
school, residents will be working on one of the twelve experiential skills they will
need to master in order to successfully complete the program and survive a night of
camping in the woods. The staff to resident ratio is 2:10. The staff consists of a
2

Program coordinator, a therapist, and nine direct care workers.
Based on the Onsite inspection and review of the Program Statement and approved
Fire, Environmental inspection and the 2003 Challenge Course annual inspection, it
is concluded that the facility meets the Child Caring Institution Licensing Rules to
add this program and to increase the capacity to 132 residents.
V. Recommendation
It is recommended that Crossroads for Youth license modification request be
approved for Girls Adventure Program (GAP) and increased capacity of 132.
